author: Joyce H
comment: I think there is lots of room to make this app even better. It would be nice to reshare photos from other Connect Users. Also there are several bugs that need worked out. For instance I cannot scroll to the bottom of long threads without the page refreshing and taking me back to the top of the page. There are other little bugs also. Fix these things and i will change my review to 5 stars. It could easily be a 5 star app if you would make it more user friendly. There are lots of great things about the app. It just needs to be better.

author: Briseis Schipperke
comment: The application is easy to use and provides real time, up-to-date information on point counts for all types of food. You can look up restaurants quickly. You'll be surprised at what you find! Gives you access to coaching and recipes at a finger tip. I think this app will help me meet my weight loss goal.

author: Kelly Setaro
comment: Edit.... would live if WW came up with a way to remind busy Moms to track their food!      Joining Weight Watchers was the best decision I've ever made. The app makes meal planning super easy, and going out to eat easy too. I love WW connect where I can find people that are going through the same things I am. Everyone is super encouraging. Love Weight Watchers!

author: A Google User
comment: Update on 2/26/18. All the bugs that drove me crazy in 2015 are gone. After being away for a time, I returned last month. This app is great. Syncs flawlessly with fitbit. Connect is fun. Best thing for me. All my data going back in time is all still here. I now rate you 5 stars!   Update 12/9 this was my switch day. Nice surprise. It works. But ... All the foods I created myself need to be done again..Update 12/8: the mobile app is back for now. My switch over day is Thursday. I do like the exercise tracking. Much better. Sunday, 12/6: The mobile app is offline again. Since this is the big switchover day, about what I expected. I wish there had been more transparency and communication during this change over.

author: Jenna Blanchette
comment: Great app so far. Love the zero smart point options for added freedom. My only problem is that I accidentally set me profile up in metric and now cannot change it into imperial. So now I have to convert my weight into kilograms every time I weigh in. There should be an option to switch after setting. If there is can someone please tell me how!

author: Lillian Russell
comment: Love the app, have no criticism towards it at the moment, all I have to say is that before I joined, I was around 160 pounds. I am now 142 and still shrinking! This program requires no work besides punching in foods and seeing how many "points" they are. I love indulging in "zero point" foods and not having to worry about caloric intake. Thank you!

I am fed up with WW for this insanely frustrating app. I have attempted to use it since Dec 2012. It works intermittently and this last update is the worst. As others have reported, it does not detect my internet connection, therefore I am unable to edit my entries. I am about to quit WW and move to a more reliable tracking method.

author: J Yu
comment: Have been using the app for years and it has improved so much. However, one new bug is annoying me - when I scan a barcode that isn't recognised, the option to create a new food no longer cones up. Please fix.

author: Karen Busse
comment: I've been using this app for a year, and it's okay. I can track most foods. The restaurant section I don't like. Some of the foods at the restaurants are not on there. I have trouble with the recipe builder, and the WW Freestyle 101 part on the app. I would like to look over a list of zero point foods, but this section never loads for me. I can't read any of the "inspirational articles" on WW Freestyle 101, it just leaves me frustrated. I think there is a lot of room for improvement for this app. :/

author: Angela Bottorff
comment: I really like the app. The only drawback is the restaurants are somewhat limited and it doesn't have a lot of food options registered, like indian food and other less "main stream foods" hell I couldn't find an appropriate nacho option.

author: Susan Ortega
comment: What happened? I've been a loyal customer since 2017 but the latest updates have made the app glitch and I can't even track online? We count on the support network during tough times but I can't use the app cause it doesn't see my Wi-Fi or mobile connection???? Please revert to previous version!

Overall the app is good. However, having used other diet apps, I am astounded that so many of my normal, over-the-counter foods are not in the database. I am not an "exotic" foodie, yet I still must manually  calculate many foods because they aren't in the database.

author: Elizabeth laich
comment: I got an error message about the server, so I uninstalled and reinstalled. Now it doest recognize my login info!! I even change my password through the normal site! I sent an email, no response. I want a refund of the remaining month I have. I'll be using my Fitbit app that actually works!

author: Tammy Baxter
comment: I love how easy it is to track what I eat, whether by scanning a food, searching the database, building my own recipe, or inserting the data from the food label.  It's quick, takes no thought, and you can mark your favorites to make it even easier in the future. The info is straight forward and helps me stay on track.  And I especially love the Connect forum because it is uplifting and really helps motivate me by seeing the before and after stories and pictures.   Only thing I would change is the addition of being able to scan a food when building a recipe.

I like the fact that there is more food that are now zero points. However dropping the 30 points a day to 23 is very hard to do. I always go over having to use the weekly points and sometimes dip into my fit points. So hopefully this will still allow me to lose weight.

If a good is not in your system,  I have to enter each food separate,  also I click on lunch it takes me to dinner,  I'm not on a normal schedule.  I can not scan foods in trader Joe's.  I like the app it helps but some things frustrate me

author: Liza Beszteri
comment: It would be nice to save our own photoes with our recipies. The recipie builder is tricky to use. If I pick snack for instance, then scan an item I would still need to allocate it to the snack slot, which is extra time.
I have a problem with it syncing with my fit bit app for exercise. I wish it would also show how many calories I have eaten and the nutritional back down of the food for the day.

author: Darcy Shenfield
comment: The latest updates have added value to the app. One improvement I would appreciate is ; while looking at who is following you, there would be an indication that you are following them as well. Also a little disappointed that my favourites don't delete if they are unused for awhile. I was told at a meeting that's how favourites worked, but maybe only for iPhone.

author: A Thomson
comment: Great, but had to change android language to Australian to see the discovery recipe. Other than that I  think it is easy to use. Works will on my tablet, but not on my (Huawei) as there is no "English Australian" option. Pity.

author: Lorrie Joule
comment: Won't allow me to scan in some stores, starts working when I walk outside. Freezes up and I have to uninstall then reinstall.

author: Tina Haller
comment: I love the scanner! I scan absolutely everything. Some days it freezes and doesn't allow you to track your food for hours, but it usually comes back up same day.

author: Rika Mead
comment: Am having what I hope is a temporary glitch in the synch function with my Fitbit.  Otherwise, am totally impressed by the overall design & applicability.  If I can remedy the synch issue,  will rate this app 5.

author: Cindi Burggraaf
comment: User friendly.  Love the scanner and ability to track from the scan. I use the app several times a day.  Convenient way to track my points.  I also like having restaurant point choices and connect available whenever I might need them!

author: Edwin Mosquera
comment: I've lost 55 lbs since March of last year. I look forward to losing more. Tracking what you eat is so much easier with this app. It keeps you motivated and helps you change the way you eat. I still enjoy the occasional junk food but now I hold myself accountable for it so I do it waaay less often.

author: Lesley Miller
comment: Great way to track on the go, super helpful when eating out. Would have given it 5 stars, except that the fractions when tracking and reading recipes are REALLY small and hard to read.

author: Cynthia Bird
comment: Love the Weight Watchers app. Easy and user friendly  with good information.  So far have not had trouble finding point values for any of the foods I looked up, and was even surprised to find some point values for recipes I use. Thanks@

author: Sarah Morley
comment: This app is the reason I'm finally able to stick to my weight management. It's great that you can scan products to see how many points they have too! It's a real game changer. Plus being able to connect with other people going through the same thing keeps me motivated, it's like we are one big family, supporting one another and cheering each other on. Best thing weight watchers has ever done is introduce this app 😁

author: Josh Wagner
comment: This app is not compatible with my android phone as I am trying to complete the tutorial by tracking my first food and nothing comes up, I am severely disappointed in the performance of an app that was made for a PAID service and I hope the bug is fixed soon

author: Caroline Clancy
comment: It does exactly what I need it to do! My biggest assistant in my weight loss journey ❤

author: Kathy Cooper
comment: I really like the app. But so much the time it just spins and Spins and spins. It's so slow. Sometimes I can't even track with it because it's slow. When it works it's a five-star!

author: Marci Byers
comment: Really like the app. The only thing that drives me crazy is that restaurants aren't sorted by points.

author: Robert Katz
comment: App was fine, new update has ruined all my "favorites" settings and values.  Ap is useless until they fix it for dedicated users!

author: Sue Carey
comment: After 6 months off I'm back today only to find out that a lot of the zero point foods still show as points in the app and was told that's 'why we have the list to reference'.  WTH??  Plus I just opened the app and got a message that my info won't load.  So the app is still as buggy as it was 3 yrs ago when I started.  Oprah should be hanging her head in shame....

author: Jessica Garcia
comment: Not too fond of diets, but this is making it easy to get back to my pre-pregnancy weight. Super easy to use and tons of 0 point options.

author: Jonathan Lawton
comment: Come on WW, buck up. It slows and crashes. I'm paying for this app, and I expect it to work. MOTOG5

author: Lucinda Smith
comment: Perfect for tracking my food since I have my phone with me all the time.  It connects great with my Fitbit so I can get my points for fitness!

author: Caroline Dyck
comment: Why pay for something that won't even let you login? Won't accept my email or login info that it lists in the confirmation email. What a rip off.

author: tiffany anderson
comment: I love WW. There's a few things about the app I wish they'd update. They come out often with updates and it's always great!

author: Amber Lee
comment: Last 2 days I haven't been able to track. Stays stuck on yesterday and won't show my daily points.
